CFM_Minthara.synopsis: The first longrest in Undercity, Orin will abduct one of the players companion. (Lae’zel, Halsin, Gale or Minthara). Based on the players approval rating with them. (Friend, Good Friend and Romance) Highest approval will be the highest priority.She will appear in camp impersonating her abducted victim and toy with the players. Shortly after, she grows tire of the game and reveals herself. And gives her ultimatum - Kill Gortash and retrieve his Netherstone - and bring it to her at her Bhaal Temple. Or the abducted companion dies. She will then teleport away.
CFM_Minthara.how_to_trigger: 1) Got the any Undercity location with Debugbook 2) -> Go to region 3) -> Act 3 4) -> Undercity 5) -> Bhaal Temple (or any other Undercity location).6) Add the companion to the camp with the Camp Debug Book.7) Go to camp by the Waypoint system, And start longRest by clicking on the bed/campfire.8) OR you can click the LongRest button from outside the camp which will end the day and teleport all to camp.9) This Campfire Moment dialog will trigger once the night starts automatically.

CFM_Gale.synopsis: The first longrest in Undercity, Orin will abduct one of the players companion. (Lae’zel, Halsin, Gale or Minthara). Based on the players approval rating with them. (Friend, Good Friend and Romance) Highest approval will be the highest priority.She will appear in camp impersonating her abducted victim and toy with the players. Shortly after, she grows tire of the game and reveals herself. And gives her ultimatum - Kill Gortash and retrieve his Netherstone - and bring it to her at her Bhaal Temple. Or the abducted companion dies. She will then teleport away.
CFM_Gale.how_to_trigger: 1) Got the any Undercity location with Debugbook 2) -> Go to region 3) -> Act 3 4) -> Undercity 5) -> Bhaal Temple (or any other Undercity location).6) Add the companion to the camp with the Camp Debug Book.7) Go to camp by the Waypoint system, And start longRest by clicking on the bed/campfire.8) OR you can click the LongRest button from outside the camp which will end the day and teleport all to camp.9) This Campfire Moment dialog will trigger once the night starts automatically.

CFM_Yenna.synopsis:
When no valid companion for abduction is available, Orin insteadbducts Yenna -  a beggar child who previously greeted players when they entered Wyrm’s Crossing, and who subsequently keeps appearing in their camp. Appearing as Yenna, Orin will try to get the player to drink a poisoned soup, before revealing herself.



 She tells the player that the real Yenna is in the Bhaal Temple, and gives them an ultimatum about killing Gortash and retrieving the Netherstone. If they do this, then she will not kill Yenna, and will duel the player instead.
CFM_Yenna.how_to_trigger: 1) Got the any Undercity location with Debugbook 2) -> Go to region 3) -> Act 3 4) -> Undercity 5) -> Bhaal Temple (or any other Undercity location).6) Add the companion to the camp with the Camp Debug Book.7) Go to camp by the Waypoint system, And start longRest by clicking on the bed/campfire.8) OR you can click the LongRest button from outside the camp which will end the day and teleport all to camp.9) This Campfire Moment dialog will trigger once the night starts automatically.

CFM_Halsin.synopsis: The first longrest in Undercity, Orin will abduct one of the players companion. (Lae’zel, Halsin, Gale or Minthara). Based on the players approval rating with them. (Friend, Good Friend and Romance) Highest approval will be the highest priority.She will appear in camp impersonating her abducted victim and toy with the players. Shortly after, she grows tire of the game and reveals herself. And gives her ultimatum - Kill Gortash and retrieve his Netherstone - and bring it to her at her Bhaal Temple. Or the abducted companion dies. She will then teleport away.
CFM_Halsin.how_to_trigger: 1) Got the any Undercity location with Debugbook 2) -> Go to region 3) -> Act 3 4) -> Undercity 5) -> Bhaal Temple (or any other Undercity location).6) Add the companion to the camp with the Camp Debug Book.7) Go to camp by the Waypoint system, And start longRest by clicking on the bed/campfire.8) OR you can click the LongRest button from outside the camp which will end the day and teleport all to camp.9) This Campfire Moment dialog will trigger once the night starts automatically.

CFM_Laezel.synopsis: The first longrest in Lower City, Orin will abduct one of the players companion. (Lae’zel, Halsin, Gale or Minthara). Based on the players approval rating with them. (Friend, Good Friend and Romance) Highest approval will be the highest priority.She will appear in camp impersonating her abducted victim and toy with the players. Shortly after, she grows tire of the game and reveals herself. And gives her ultimatum - Kill Gortash and retrieve his Netherstone - and bring it to her at her Bhaal Temple. Or the abducted companion dies. She will then teleport away.
CFM_Laezel.how_to_trigger: 1) Got the any Lower City location with Debugbook 2) -> Go to region 3) -> Act 3 4) -> Undercity 5) -> Bhaal Temple (or any other Undercity location).6) Add the companion to the camp with the Camp Debug Book.7) Go to camp by the Waypoint system, And start longRest by clicking on the bed/campfire.8) OR you can click the LongRest button from outside the camp which will end the day and teleport all to camp.9) This Campfire Moment dialog will trigger once the night starts automatically.

CFM_Minthara_108.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_108.text: You. This way. Quickly. Eyes down.
CFM_Minthara_108.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the party enters camp, they are intercepted by a bloodied and bruised Minthara. She indicates for them to follow her.

CFM_Minthara_49.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_49.text: Good. Nobody saw you arrive - that will be to our advantage.
CFM_Minthara_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player follows Minthara to a secluded area.

CFM_Minthara_79.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_79.text: You're covered in gore. More so than usual.

CFM_Minthara_107.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_107.text: I knew you couldn't wait to get me alone again.

CFM_Minthara_64.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_64.text: Idiot. Think with your brain, not your groin for once.

CFM_Minthara_67.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_67.text: Are we playing hide and seek?

CFM_Minthara_11.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_11.text: Yes. Menzoberranzan rules. If we're found, we die.

CFM_Minthara_38.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_38.text: My life is in danger. As I knew it would be the moment I joined you.

CFM_Minthara_45.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_45.text: Wyll asked to speak with me alone, and the moment my back was turned, he tried to kill me.

CFM_Minthara_112.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_112.text: Naturally, he didn't stand a chance. I dealt with him.

CFM_Minthara_119.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_119.text: That brute Karlach asked to speak to me alone. Told me I was no better than the devils who once imprisoned her.

CFM_Minthara_95.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_95.text: Jaheira took me to one side - told me the whole party are against me. That she was the only one bold enough to do what needed to be done.

CFM_Minthara_36.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_36.text: That fawning cleric Isobel asked to speak with me alone. Told me her goddess had asked her to extinguish me.

CFM_Minthara_78.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_78.text: And then she tried to kill me.

CFM_Minthara_90.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_90.text: Gale asked to speak with me alone, and the moment my back was turned, he tried to kill me.

CFM_Minthara_51.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_51.text: The vampire asked to speak to me alone. Accused me of being a threat to your wellbeing, if you can believe it.

CFM_Minthara_121.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_121.text: Shadowheart came to me, flashing those puppy-dog eyes. Asked for my counsel, in private.

CFM_Minthara_75.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_75.text: She was confused. Said the gods had a plan for her, and that I was a threat to it.

CFM_Minthara_1.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_1.text: The githyanki asked me to teach her some combat techniques - naturally, I was pleased to be consulted.

CFM_Minthara_35.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_35.text: But the moment we were alone, she spouted some drivel about my integrity and loyalty.

CFM_Minthara_76.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_76.text: And then she tried to kill me.

CFM_Minthara_16.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_16.text: Naturally, she didn't stand a chance. I dealt with her.

CFM_Minthara_83.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_83.text: I think Orin is behind this - she may have infiltrated our camp.

CFM_Minthara_25.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_25.text: No. If the blood-witch were here, I'd be able to smell her.

CFM_Minthara_85.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_85.text: This threat has been with us since Moonrise.

CFM_Minthara_28.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minthara steps aside. Behind her, we see a heap on the floor, human sized, covered with a dark, bloody cloth. No part of the body is visible, but a pool of blood is just visible beneath it.

CFM_Minthara_13.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_13.text: Of course I did. Anyone who threatens me either kills me, or dies.

CFM_Minthara_118.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_118.text: The others have despised my presence here since I joined you.

CFM_Minthara_23.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_23.text: I have heard them whisper, I have seen the way they look at me. They begin to see you in the same light.

CFM_Minthara_71.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_71.text: Our relationship disturbs them. It is not only me they conspire to assassinate. They will kill us both.

CFM_Minthara_37.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_37.text: Let's butcher them all - I've been waiting for an excuse.

CFM_Minthara_17.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_17.text: Do you have any proof of this?

CFM_Minthara_89.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_89.text: My proof lies beneath that blanket.

CFM_Minthara_74.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_74.text: I only kill when it is necessary. This was necessary.

CFM_Minthara_100.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_100.text: Now we are both in danger.

CFM_Minthara_58.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_58.text: We need to kill them all.

CFM_Minthara_41.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_41.text: That is the correct course. I was prepared to convince you - I am glad I do not have to.

CFM_Minthara_10.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_10.text: We can talk them around. They listen to me.

CFM_Minthara_50.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_50.text: Pathetic. You don't negotiate with people who wish you dead. You kill them.

CFM_Minthara_44.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_44.text: First, we must dispose of the body. What comes next will be... simpler if we don't arouse suspicions.

CFM_Minthara_122.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_122.text: When the body is hidden, we wait until the dead of night, and kill the others as they sleep.

CFM_Minthara_9.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_9.text: Let's do it while they're awake. It'll be more enjoyable. Please.

CFM_Minthara_101.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_101.text: Tempting tempting tempting. But not yet. Not yet.
CFM_Minthara_101.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin-as-Minthara smiles at the player, seductivelyNodeContext: Bossy

CFM_Minthara_84.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_84.text: You made this mess. You're on your own.

CFM_Minthara_30.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_30.text: Will you watch when the others kill me? Will you hold my head back while they cut my throat? Whisper goodbyes as I gasp and bleed?
CFM_Minthara_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minthara smiles.NodeContext: with a smile - knows her plan is about to be set in motion

CFM_Minthara_3.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_3.text: You're a murderer, Minthara. I can't let you walk away.

CFM_Minthara_116.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_116.text: You could stick me through the heart. Stick her through the heart. Cut us to bits.
CFM_Minthara_116.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player/party draw their weapon. Minthara smilesNodeContext: with a smile - knows her plan is about to be set in motion

CFM_Minthara_43.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_43.text: Why should I trust you on this? You're a murderer!

CFM_Minthara_20.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_20.text: As are you. Consider yourself lucky that I trust you, or you would not be alive to doubt me.

CFM_Minthara_46.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_46.text: Conspirators? Assassins? Listen to yourself, Minthara.

CFM_Minthara_12.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_12.text: When we met, I was beholden to a cult dedicated to a false god that controlled me through a parasite in my brain.

CFM_Minthara_15.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_15.text: This latest conspiracy is rather ordinary in comparison. As is the solution.

CFM_Minthara_104.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_104.text: I'm sorry, Minthara. I thought you would be safe here.

CFM_Minthara_106.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_106.text: You are not to blame. It is easy for one who has lived a coddled life to mistake my caution for paranoia.

CFM_Minthara_87.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_87.text: I don't understand. Why would anyone try to kill you now?

CFM_Minthara_97.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_97.text: Opportunism. My guard was down. It was the first time - it will be the last.

CFM_Minthara_66.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_66.text: I welcome you into my camp, and this is how you repay me?

CFM_Minthara_48.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_48.text: I will not apologise for defending myself.

CFM_Minthara_62.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_62.text: The aasimar asked for a word in private. I find her sanctimony irritating, but I agreed to speak with her.

CFM_Minthara_54.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_54.text: Minsc asked to speak to me alone - I expected his usual righteous drivel. Annoying, but harmless.

CFM_Minthara_77.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_77.text: But this time was different. He tried to kill me.

CFM_Minthara_26.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_26.text: Ravengard asked to speak with me alone, and the moment my back was turned, he tried to kill me.

CFM_Minthara_113.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_113.text: I caught the girl, Yenna, rifling through my belongings. When I confronted her, she pulled a knife on me.

CFM_Minthara_56.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_56.text: I overpowered her, of course. A thief I can tolerate, but under duress she admitted to being a spy.

CFM_Minthara_5.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_5.text: Someone has betrayed our presence here. A spy.

CFM_Minthara_27.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_27.text: It was the girl, Yenna. I have dealt with the problem.

CFM_Minthara_109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minthara steps aside. Behind her, we see a heap on the floor, human sized, covered with a dark, bloody cloth. No part of the body is visible, but a pool of blood is just visible beneath it.

CFM_Minthara_14.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_14.text: Not the first. I killed my sister in her crib to secure my inheritance.

CFM_Minthara_21.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_21.text: Children should not play at such dangerous games, if they fear getting hurt. This one made some dangerous friends.

CFM_Minthara_81.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_81.text: The cult plan to attack our camp. Tonight.

CFM_Minthara_69.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_69.text: We must not rest tonight. We must lie in wait for them.

CFM_Minthara_120.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_120.text: First, we must dispose of their little spy. Burial or dismemberment. Either will suffice.

CFM_Minthara_42.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_42.text: Grim work. But it has to be done.

CFM_Minthara_68.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_68.text: I don't want to be an accessory to child murder.

CFM_Minthara_86.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_86.text: Whatever her crimes, I can't abide the murder of a child in our camp.

CFM_Minthara_61.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_61.text: Who do you think sent them?

CFM_Minthara_57.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_57.text: They plan to attack our camp. Tonight.

CFM_Minthara_80.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_80.text: How do you know they were a spy?

CFM_Minthara_19.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_19.text: The creature confessed, of course. Their childish bravado didn't last long. They told me everything.

CFM_Minthara_98.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_98.text: All I had to do was twist my knife.

CFM_Minthara_73.speaker: Player
CFM_Minthara_73.text: Good work. Our camp is in safe hands with you.

CFM_Minthara_60.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Minthara
CFM_Minthara_60.text: I may have been too late. She already reported to her superiors.

CFM_Gale_21.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_21.text: Forgive me. I was lost in my thoughts, as usual.
CFM_Gale_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the player enters camp, Gale stands gazing into the fire. He looks lost, brooding. Hearing the player approach, he turns to greet them.

CFM_Gale_42.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_42.text: I've found myself in something of a quandry. Yours is an opinion I'd gladly hear on the matter.

CFM_Gale_8.speaker: Player
CFM_Gale_8.text: You know I'll always help you.

CFM_Gale_7.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_7.text: Careful. You don't know what I'm about to ask.

CFM_Gale_41.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_41.text: I fear our unwillingness to make difficult decisions is doing more harm than good.

CFM_Gale_34.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_34.text: I regret straying from Mystra's instruction. All the suffering around us, it is our fault. I am reconsidering taking a more drastic approach.
CFM_Gale_34.context: NodeContext: Beginning to relate his issue

CFM_Gale_64.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_64.text: Every day we spend inching our way towards our enemies is a day we choose to let countless die in the Absolute's path.

CFM_Gale_19.speaker: Player
CFM_Gale_19.text: You think I've been holding back this whole time?

CFM_Gale_63.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_63.text: My apologies. I shouldn't place my own guilt onto your shoulders.

CFM_Gale_35.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_35.text: I'm afraid to say I have been holding back. Every. Single. Day.

CFM_Gale_51.speaker: Player
CFM_Gale_51.text: If 'drastic' means violent, then count me in.

CFM_Gale_16.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_16.text: As always, I'm grateful for your enthusiasm. And yes, it will require some amount of brutality on our part.

CFM_Gale_26.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_26.text: We both know the orb I carry inside me is powerful enough to burn away the Absolute's blight in an instant.

CFM_Gale_49.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_49.text: But what stays my hand? Obstinacy? Misplaced morals? Simple fear of dying? You?

CFM_Gale_11.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_11.text: The inevitable has been delayed far too long already - no more, I say. It's time to make a stand.

CFM_Gale_48.speaker: Player
CFM_Gale_48.text: But I thought you had your heart set on the Crown of Karsus? A difficult thing to aspire to, if you're dead.

CFM_Gale_65.speaker: Player
CFM_Gale_65.text: There's no need for anything so drastic. You thought the Crown of Karsus was worth pursuing...

CFM_Gale_5.speaker: Player
CFM_Gale_5.text: We haven't yet learned what the crown might be capable of. I thought you wanted to find out?

CFM_Gale_9.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_9.text: A passing fancy, one that has lost its lustre. No - unleashing the power within me will be far more magnificent than some crown.
CFM_Gale_9.context: NodeContext: dismissing his old opinion, growwing fervour/intensity - he's excited by this idea

CFM_Gale_52.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_52.text: The day will come when I lose control of the power within me anyway. There's nothing you or I can do to stop that.
CFM_Gale_52.context: NodeContext: assertive, not to be questioned

CFM_Gale_36.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_36.text: Gods damned if I'm going to let it be for nothing. If Mystra gave me one purpose, it was this: to destroy Baldur's Gate, and the Absolute with it.
CFM_Gale_36.context: NodeContext: Determined, this is the right thing to do

CFM_Gale_24.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale assumes a spell-casting pose, muttering a strange incantation. He begins to glow fiercely. The player braces themselves agains a brilliant flash of magic. The player staggers, then realises they're unharmed. They open their eyes, dazed. Instead of Gale, it is now Orin stood before us.NodeContext: Latin spellcasting, pronounced 'Kay-see ver-um vid-eh-ant' ('let the blind see the truth')

CFM_Gale_53.speaker: Player
CFM_Gale_53.text: So be it. End this, once and for all.

CFM_Gale_6.speaker: Player
CFM_Gale_6.text: A city snuffed out in one moment: it will be a beautiful offering for Bhaal.

CFM_Gale_38.speaker: Player
CFM_Gale_38.text: Try it, and you'll be dead before you utter your first syllable.

CFM_Gale_56.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_56.text: Kill me, and I'll destroy the city anyway.

CFM_Gale_18.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_18.text: So quick to turn on your friends... a sure sign of an unsound mind, and a villainous heart.

CFM_Gale_33.speaker: Player
CFM_Gale_33.text: Please, Gale. You're better than this.

CFM_Gale_2.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_2.text: There is nothing better than leaving in a blaze of glory.

CFM_Gale_45.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_45.text: So gentle. You think saving him will stop the bloodshed? It won't.

CFM_Gale_10.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_10.text: Most foolish. Wanton violence against your dear Gale? After all, the man has a budding apocalypse tucked beside his heart - you would provoke it?
CFM_Gale_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player readies their weapon, but Gale throws up a hand. The player hesitates.

CFM_Gale_54.speaker: Player
CFM_Gale_54.text: What makes you think it will work?

CFM_Gale_32.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_32.text: I know how much power rests within me - enough to turn Baldur's Gate to ashes, its memory to no more than a children's fable.

CFM_Gale_20.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_20.text: Act now, and we take out the brain and every footsoldier in the Absolute's army. All their hatred, their bile, their violence - erased. It would finally be over.

CFM_Gale_15.speaker: Player
CFM_Gale_15.text: It wouldn't only kill Absolutists - it would kill everyone. You can't be serious.

CFM_Gale_61.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_61.text: Deadly serious. This is the burden we must carry - to condemn the few to save the many, or Baldur's Gate will only be the first city to fall.

CFM_Gale_62.speaker: Player
CFM_Gale_62.text: I disagree. Using restraint has kept us alive so far.

CFM_Gale_12.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_12.text: That may be, but has it put a stop to the Absolute? Or cured us of our tadpoles?

CFM_Gale_44.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_44.text: All we've done is delay the inevitable, a delay that puts thousands more lives at risk. But those lives can be saved.

CFM_Gale_50.speaker: Player
CFM_Gale_50.text: Of course. What's on your mind?

CFM_Gale_60.speaker: Player
CFM_Gale_60.text: I didn't know you thought so highly of my opinions.

CFM_Gale_23.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_23.text: Of course! I find them to be almost the same quality as my own.

CFM_Gale_14.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_14.text: Just a bit of late-night humour for you. Your input would be most welcome.
CFM_Gale_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player raises an eyebrow.

CFM_Gale_4.speaker: Player
CFM_Gale_4.text: An intellectual dilemma to round off the evening? Sounds just the thing.

CFM_Gale_22.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_22.text: A puzzle for the mind, I'd solve quite comfortably. Unfortunately, this is a struggle for the heart.

CFM_Gale_57.speaker: Player
CFM_Gale_57.text: Sounds a bit heavy for so late an hour. Another time.

CFM_Gale_59.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Gale
CFM_Gale_59.text: Wait. What I have to say... well, there may not be another chance. Please.

CFM_Yenna_35.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_35.text: A bit of salt on the top and -
CFM_Yenna_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player enters camp. They find Yenna in a secluded area of camp, her back to them. She is facing a small cooking fire, unrecogniseable pieces of meat roasting over it on a skewer. We can't see what she's doing.

CFM_Yenna_48.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_48.text: Argh! You're here. I'm not ready. I mean, I think I'm ready.
CFM_Yenna_48.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player approaches while Yenna has her back to them. Yenna notices them and turns. We see she holds a small skewer with several pieces of meat [LOGAN] in her left hand.

CFM_Yenna_81.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_81.text: Please, don't hurt me. I know you don't want me but - give me a chance.
CFM_Yenna_81.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player approaches while Yenna has her back to them. Yenna notices them and turns. We see she holds a small skewer with several pieces of meat [LOGAN] in her left hand.

CFM_Yenna_19.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_19.text: Argh! You're here. I know you don't know me very well, but please - give me a chance.
CFM_Yenna_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player approaches while Yenna has her back to them. Yenna notices them and turns. We see she holds a small skewer with several pieces of meat [LOGAN] in her left hand.

CFM_Yenna_52.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_52.text: I - I thought you'd be hungry, so I made this for you. My mum's favourite recipe.

CFM_Yenna_79.speaker: Player
CFM_Yenna_79.text: When I invited you to camp, I didn't expect you to follow me into the city.

CFM_Yenna_82.speaker: Player
CFM_Yenna_82.text: Did you break into my room? I told you to stay away from me.

CFM_Yenna_78.speaker: Player
CFM_Yenna_78.text: The Elfsong needs better security. Are you up to some mischief in here?

CFM_Yenna_31.speaker: Player
CFM_Yenna_31.text: What have I done to earn this?

CFM_Yenna_51.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_51.text: You let me stay, when I didn't have nowhere else to go.

CFM_Yenna_0.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_0.text: No one ever cares about me like that. Not since my mum.

CFM_Yenna_75.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_75.text: I wanted to do something to show I was worth keeping around. I want to be your cook.
CFM_Yenna_75.context: NodeContext: nervous, trying to impress you

CFM_Yenna_14.speaker: Player
CFM_Yenna_14.text: You don't need to prove anything. You're welcome here.

CFM_Yenna_93.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_93.text: You really mean it? I'll - I'll make you proud. I'll be the best cook you ever had.
CFM_Yenna_93.context: CinematicNodeContext: Yenna smiles brightly.NodeContext: bubbling over, relieved, excited

CFM_Yenna_27.speaker: Player
CFM_Yenna_27.text: You're in luck! A position has just opened up.

CFM_Yenna_9.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_9.text: It has? You're not just making it up?
CFM_Yenna_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Yenna looks a little suspicious. The player shakes their head - they aren't making this up.

CFM_Yenna_45.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_45.text: Oh, thank you! Thank you! You won't regret this. I'll - I'll be the best cook you ever had.

CFM_Yenna_73.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_73.text: Do - do you want to try it?
CFM_Yenna_73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Yenna offers the skewer to the playerNodeContext: Hopeful -really wants you to like the food she offers

CFM_Yenna_94.speaker: Player
CFM_Yenna_94.text: Perhaps later, when I've more of an appetite.

CFM_Yenna_2.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_2.text: Did - did I do something wrong?
CFM_Yenna_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: [LOGAN] Still holding skewer in Left hand. NodeContext: Sad, scared she's in trouble

CFM_Yenna_63.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_63.text: I - I made is especially for you. I thought you'd like it.
CFM_Yenna_63.context: CinematicNodeContext: [LOGAN] Still holding skewer in Left hand. NodeContext: Sadly, disappointed

CFM_Yenna_46.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_46.text: It took me hours to chop the little vegetables and get the meat roasted right. And now you won't even try it...
CFM_Yenna_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Yenna, still offering the skewer, looks heartbroken, on the verge of tears. Almost impossible to refuse.NodeContext: Sad, sniffly like she's about to cry

CFM_Yenna_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player removes a pieces of meat from the skewer (unseen in their hand), brings their hand to their mouth, eating the meat. Yenna watches, anxious to see their reaction. The player smiles, relieved - it's delicious.

CFM_Yenna_37.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_37.context: NodeContext: with a smile, a bit smug

CFM_Yenna_1.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_1.text: You know why? Because I put in my secret ingredient.

CFM_Yenna_96.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_96.text: Want me to tell you what it is?

CFM_Yenna_87.speaker: Player
CFM_Yenna_87.text: Did - did you cook your cat?

CFM_Yenna_89.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_89.text: You've tasted it's flesh before? Isn't it delicious?
CFM_Yenna_89.context: CinematicNodeContext: Yenna smiles sweetlyNodeContext: Wicked delight - like you share a naughty secret.

CFM_Yenna_60.speaker: Player
CFM_Yenna_60.text: Go on then - what is it?

CFM_Yenna_58.speaker: Player
CFM_Yenna_58.text: You're going to tell me anyway, aren't you?

CFM_Yenna_53.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_53.text: I put a special meat inside.
CFM_Yenna_53.context: NodeContext: Giggling, like this is the funniest practical joke

CFM_Yenna_6.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_6.text: Such a sweet little kitten. Oh how it screamed.
CFM_Yenna_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Yenna smiles sweetly. She steps aside, to reveal the body of Yenna's cat, roasting over the fire.NodeContext: Childish cruelty - glee in the cat's suffering

CFM_Yenna_42.speaker: Player
CFM_Yenna_42.text: I'd rather not find out, to be honest.

CFM_Yenna_88.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_88.text: You already know. You felt it purr as it slid down your throat.
CFM_Yenna_88.context: NodeContext: Childish cruelty - glee in the cat's suffering

CFM_Yenna_66.speaker: Player
CFM_Yenna_66.text: Taste the meal again. Try to identify the secret ingredient.

CFM_Yenna_12.speaker: Narrator
CFM_Yenna_12.text: *The herbs and spices are ones you recognise, staples in Baldurian cuisine. But the meat itself is unusual - gamey, tough, with a distinctly feline quality.*
CFM_Yenna_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player eats another mouthful of the meal. Chews, thinking. Their eyes widen when they realise they're eating cat.

CFM_Yenna_70.speaker: Player
CFM_Yenna_70.context: CinematicNodeContext: DU bites the cat again

CFM_Yenna_44.speaker: Narrator
CFM_Yenna_44.text: *You taste nothing out of the ordinary - the herbs and spices sold by any market trader.*
CFM_Yenna_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player eats another mouthful of the meal. Chews, thinking, but can't work it out.

CFM_Yenna_38.speaker: Player
CFM_Yenna_38.text: Too right. No way I'm eating that.

CFM_Yenna_55.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_55.text: What a waste of good flesh.

CFM_Yenna_39.speaker: Player
CFM_Yenna_39.text: Take the food. Throw it away.

CFM_Yenna_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player removes a pieces of meat from the skewer (unseen in their hand), looks at it, looks at Yenna, then carelessly tosses it away.

CFM_Yenna_64.speaker: Player
CFM_Yenna_64.text: No way in the hells I'm eating that.

CFM_Yenna_69.speaker: Player
CFM_Yenna_69.text: Don't you have any other skills?

CFM_Yenna_32.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_32.text: Well, um, I can sew a little bit. And, um, I know most of the letters for my writing.
CFM_Yenna_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player raises an eyebrow - is that it?NodeContext: a little scared, desperately trying to remember anything she's good at

CFM_Yenna_43.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_43.text: I think cooking is really my main talent.

CFM_Yenna_80.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_80.text: Please, just try it. I promise it's good.
CFM_Yenna_80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Yenna offers the skewer to the playerNodeContext: persuading, nervous

CFM_Yenna_47.speaker: Player
CFM_Yenna_47.text: One mediocre meal isn't enough to earn a place in my camp.

CFM_Yenna_3.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_3.text: It's not mediocre! You - you haven't even tried it!

CFM_Yenna_83.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_83.text: You don't believe me do you? Taste it, and then tell me it's 'mediocre'.
CFM_Yenna_83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Yenna offers the skewer to the playerNodeContext: challenging the player to try it

CFM_Yenna_62.speaker: Player
CFM_Yenna_62.text: First let me try the food. Then I'll decide.

CFM_Yenna_74.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_74.text: I- I hope you like it.
CFM_Yenna_74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Yenna offers the skewer to the player

CFM_Yenna_30.speaker: Player
CFM_Yenna_30.text: Get the hells out of here.

CFM_Yenna_13.speaker: Player
CFM_Yenna_13.text: I made myself clear. You're not welcome here.

CFM_Yenna_95.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_95.text: I know. But I don't have nowhere else to go.

CFM_Yenna_92.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_92.text: I didn't come to beg. I can work. I can cook for you. I can help - let me prove it.

CFM_Yenna_21.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_21.text: It's called Heap Gate Mess. A Baldur's Gate classic.

CFM_Yenna_54.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_54.text: My mum always used to make it for me. She used to change the recipe a lot, 'cause she had to, um, borrow some of the ingredients.

CFM_Yenna_49.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_49.text: I put in some bits from your supplies. I hope you don't mind.

CFM_Yenna_5.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_5.text: She used to work in the kitchens at some fancy noble's house.

CFM_Yenna_24.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_24.text: I- I know it won't be good like she used to do. But I think I remembered everything.

CFM_Yenna_25.speaker: Player
CFM_Yenna_25.text: You're up to something. Go on - spit it out.

CFM_Yenna_84.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_84.text: No - I'm not up to anything! I just wanted to say thank you.

CFM_Yenna_76.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Yenna
CFM_Yenna_76.text: Well I - I just wanted you to give me a chance.

CFM_Halsin_22.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player enters camp. Pauses - what's that sound? Coming from a secluded area of camp, the angry growl/roar of an animal in distress. (this is Halsin in bear form - anguished, going mad)

CFM_Halsin_33.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player rushes towards the sound. They find Halsin, in bear form, his back to us. He turns and ROARS at us, eyes red, spittle flying, rabid. We see beyond him, to Scratch/Yenna lying motionless on the ground.

CFM_Halsin_34.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player enters camp. Pauses - what's that sound? Coming from a secluded area of camp, the angry growl/roar of an animal in distress. (this is Halsin in bear form - anguished, going mad)

CFM_Halsin_28.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player rushes towards the sound. They find Halsin, in bear form, his back to us. He turns and ROARS at us, eyes red, spittle flying, rabid. We see beyond him, to Scratch/Yenna lying motionless on the ground.

CFM_Halsin_20.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear looks back at the motionless victim on the floor, lets out a cry of anguish.

CFM_Halsin_29.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_29.text: Oak Father forgive me... I can explain, I swear.
CFM_Halsin_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin transforms back to his regular form. He looks sickened, close to death.NodeContext: Saddened, horrified. First part to self, rest to player.

CFM_Halsin_10.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_10.text: It's this place. This city. I can feel its corruption eating away at me. I should not be here - no one should be here.

CFM_Halsin_15.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_15.text: It has made a monster of me.

CFM_Halsin_42.speaker: Player
CFM_Halsin_42.text: I don't understand. What does the city have to do with this?

CFM_Halsin_57.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_57.text: It has everything to do with this place. The rot is all around us.

CFM_Halsin_32.speaker: Player
CFM_Halsin_32.text: You're an archdruid. Whatever's affecting you, resist it.

CFM_Halsin_38.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_38.text: I can't... Whatever powers I have, they are dwarfed by the evil of this place.

CFM_Halsin_9.speaker: Player
CFM_Halsin_9.text: No. You're responsible for your own actions. And you'll have to pay for them as well.

CFM_Halsin_26.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_26.text: I shall - trust me. But heed my words. This city is doomed.

CFM_Halsin_25.speaker: Player
CFM_Halsin_25.text: How can you be sure? I feel no such corruption.

CFM_Halsin_21.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_21.text: I am an archdruid - every fibre of my mind is attuned to nature. Give it time - you will sense the rot as well.

CFM_Halsin_52.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_52.text: Silvanus has abandoned this place. It's nothing but stone, grime, smoke, pain. The trees choke here. The animals hang from butchers' hooks. Nature is dying in the gutter.
CFM_Halsin_52.context: NodeContext: Growing more intense, as if becoming overcome by anger and dark thoughts.

CFM_Halsin_47.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_47.text: There is only one god fit to be bowed to in this place. The last god who will ever be knelt before... then all of this will tear itself apart -
CFM_Halsin_47.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Halsin cuts off suddenly, racked with a horrible cough. He covers his mouth with his hand. 

We need Halsin standing for this line. Then he coughs at the end of the node, lowering his head a little, covering his mouth with the palm of his right hand. NodeContext: End with a violent cough (coughing up blood)

CFM_Halsin_30.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_30.text: My body is trying to fight the corruption... but it's losing. And my mind will succumb soon after.
CFM_Halsin_30.context:
CinematicNodeContext: When he removes his hand from his face, we see he's coughed up blood.

Node starts with Halsin lowering his right hand from his mouth. He holds his hand out in front of him for a moment, revealing that he has coughed up blood. This is while he delivers the VO line. NodeContext: Slightly more lucid, but stricken and fearful

CFM_Halsin_12.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin, standing up right in human form, starts to sway, losing his balance. He drops to the ground on all fours. He roars in frustration, still in his human form (Human roar). It is as if he may turn back to a bear at any moment, involuntarily.NodeContext: Bestial groan-roar of pain (human vocals)

CFM_Halsin_18.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_18.text: I will not allow it. I will not surrender control. Even in this place, there are still innocents.
CFM_Halsin_18.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Halsin, down on all fours, straightens up so that he is kneeling in front of the player. 

He draws a dagger, places the tip of it over his heart, holding it with both hands.

CFM_Halsin_35.speaker: Player
CFM_Halsin_35.text: Slap the blade from his hand.

CFM_Halsin_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player lunges forwards, but with uncanny speed of reaction, Halsin flings the blade shooting past the player's ear. The player dodges it, only to see it vanish into smoke. They turn back to Halsin, confused -

CFM_Halsin_1.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_1.text: Slow. You'll need to be much, much faster if you want to save the big ox.
CFM_Halsin_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin smiles unpleasantly.No dagger, it was thrown away at this point.NodeContext: Taunting

CFM_Halsin_55.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_55.text: No. This is how it must be...
CFM_Halsin_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding blade with both hands  at his heart NodeContext: Hasty, resigned

CFM_Halsin_41.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_41.text: ...Or is it? Perhaps if you're a little faster, you may yet save the big ox.
CFM_Halsin_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin pulls out the bladefrom his chest both hands. He smiles.NodeContext: Taunting

CFM_Halsin_58.speaker: Player
CFM_Halsin_58.text: Think fast. There must be another explanation for this - some way to treat Halsin.

CFM_Halsin_4.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_4.text: Do you think a poultice will unspill your friend's guts? A herbal tea will ungouge his eyes? Try if you like - the time to save him is dwindling fast...
CFM_Halsin_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin smiles unpleasantly. lowering the dagger.NodeContext: Taunting

CFM_Halsin_2.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_2.text: I can see your mind at work, my friend. But it's too late. Time to let go...

CFM_Halsin_51.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_51.text: Mmm. I feel like a new man. A sharp blade is a true tonic. Your friend will find out for himself, soon enough...
CFM_Halsin_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin pulls out the blade from his chest with both hands. He smiles.NodeContext: Taunting

CFM_Halsin_53.speaker: Player
CFM_Halsin_53.text: Wait - this must be Orin's doing. She's compromised our camp.

CFM_Halsin_49.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_49.text: So close to grasping the problem, but you fell short all the same. You had better sharpen those wits if you hope to spare your friend the true blade.
CFM_Halsin_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin smiles unpleasantly. lowering the dagger.NodeContext: Taunting

CFM_Halsin_24.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_24.text: The blood is on my hands, in the end. No more.

CFM_Halsin_36.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_36.text: You almost figured it out. But almost won't save your friend. You had better up your game if you hope to truly save him.
CFM_Halsin_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin pulls out the blade from his chest with noth hands. He smiles unpleasantly.NodeContext: Taunting

CFM_Halsin_48.speaker: Player
CFM_Halsin_48.text: Lower! Stick it in the guts, not the heart! Make it last!

CFM_Halsin_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin closes his eyes and RAMS the blade into his guts. He splutters, opens his eyes wide with the pain.

CFM_Halsin_14.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_14.text: Did you enjoy the show? It was but an opening act, blood kin.
CFM_Halsin_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin pulls out the blade from his belly with both hands. He smiles.NodeContext: Taunting

CFM_Halsin_6.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_6.text: After all you've been through together, you just idly stand by as he pours his heart out for you? Tut tut.
CFM_Halsin_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin pulls out the blade from his chest with both hands. He smiles unpleasantly.NodeContext: Taunting

CFM_Halsin_50.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear advances on the player, snarling. The player steps back, braces for an attack - but the bear pauses. His eyes soften.

CFM_Halsin_44.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Halsin
CFM_Halsin_44.text: Please... wait. I did not want this. I could not stop it.
CFM_Halsin_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin transforms back to his regular form. He looks sickened, close to death.NodeContext: Saddened, horrified.

CFM_Halsin_3.speaker: Player
CFM_Halsin_3.text: Raise your palms in a peaceful gesture. Try to calm him.

CFM_Halsin_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player reaches out their hands in a placatory, soothing gesture (doesn't make contact).

CFM_Laezel_41.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Laezel
CFM_Laezel_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player enters camp. Walking into a secluded area (e.g. private room in Elfsong) they find Lea'zel gripping a terrified Yenna by the collar.NodeContext: kainyank = cursed child

CFM_Laezel_24.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Laezel
CFM_Laezel_24.text: I shall cleave the truth from you like flesh from a dhour.

CFM_Laezel_20.speaker: Yenna
CFM_Laezel_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Yenna struggles against Lae'zel's vice-like grip, unable to free herself. She spots the player -

CFM_Laezel_33.speaker: Player
CFM_Laezel_33.text: What in the hells is going on here?

CFM_Laezel_5.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Laezel
CFM_Laezel_5.text: This is not the whelp who's been following us.

CFM_Laezel_11.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Laezel
CFM_Laezel_11.text: I saw her - she slipped into camp in the form of a woman and shifted into this... abomination.

CFM_Laezel_25.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Laezel
CFM_Laezel_25.text: She tried to silence me and hide her deception.
CFM_Laezel_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel tightens her grip/shakes Yenna, silencing her. She points out a vicious cut along the side of her face.

CFM_Laezel_1.speaker: Yenna
CFM_Laezel_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player raises an eyebrow - this is more serious than they thought. Yenna panics.

CFM_Laezel_3.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Laezel
CFM_Laezel_3.text: Gortash warned you of this? Then there is nothing left to discuss.

CFM_Laezel_28.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Laezel
CFM_Laezel_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Yenna whimpers as Lae'zel pulls her head back and draws a dagger, ready to slit her throat.

CFM_Laezel_12.speaker: Player
CFM_Laezel_12.text: We can't take the risk, Yenna. I'm sorry.

CFM_Laezel_4.speaker: Yenna
CFM_Laezel_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel smiles - this has gone perfectly.NodeContext: Terror, cut off as Lae'zel cuts her throat

CFM_Laezel_31.speaker: Player
CFM_Laezel_31.text: It's your decision Lae'zel. I want no part in this.

CFM_Laezel_37.speaker: Player
CFM_Laezel_37.text: I don't care if she's Orin or not. Kill her.

CFM_Laezel_21.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Laezel
CFM_Laezel_21.text: You'd turn on me to save this ignorant whelp. Do I mean so little to you?

CFM_Laezel_19.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Laezel
CFM_Laezel_19.text: You may lack resolve - but I do not.

CFM_Laezel_6.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Laezel
CFM_Laezel_6.text: Blood and tears taste so sweet together. Ambrosia fit for Bhaal himself.
CFM_Laezel_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel slits Yenna's throat (off-screen). Yenna hits the ground, face wet with tears. A few guttural gasps, and she's dead. The rest of the party look on in horror. Lae'zel licks the blood from her blade.

CFM_Laezel_34.speaker: Player
CFM_Laezel_34.text: There's something we're not seeing here.

CFM_Laezel_40.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Laezel
CFM_Laezel_40.text: Perhaps if I remove your eyes, you'll see things as they are.

CFM_Laezel_35.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Laezel
CFM_Laezel_35.text: Then let us expose the truth through action.

CFM_Laezel_0.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Laezel
CFM_Laezel_0.text: There - a corpse like any other.
CFM_Laezel_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel slits Yenna's throat (off-screen). Yenna hits the ground, face wet with tears. A few guttural gasps, and she's dead. The rest of the party look on in horror. Lae'zel licks the blood from her blade.

CFM_Laezel_17.speaker: Player
CFM_Laezel_17.text: She doesn't seem to be putting up much of a fight...

CFM_Laezel_23.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Laezel
CFM_Laezel_23.text: Her wits are about her - she knows we outnumber her.

CFM_Laezel_30.speaker: Player
CFM_Laezel_30.text: Kill her then - get it over with.

CFM_Laezel_32.speaker: Yenna
CFM_Laezel_32.text: I-I just came to get warm! I - I like it here with you and -

CFM_Laezel_10.speaker: Player
CFM_Laezel_10.text: Let her go, Lae'zel. She's a child!

CFM_Laezel_15.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Laezel
CFM_Laezel_15.text: Do not be deceived by her paltry form. This is no child. This is a shapeshifter who intends to slay us where we sleep.

CFM_Laezel_2.speaker: Player
CFM_Laezel_2.text: Another normal evening in camp, I see.

CFM_Laezel_27.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Laezel
CFM_Laezel_27.text: Stay out of this. She is mine to purge.
